title: SEC Charges J.P. Morgan Affiliates
J.P. Morgan to Settle SEC Charges
CFTC Orders J.P. Morgan to Pay $200M
SEC Settles with J.P. Morgan Affiliates
CFTC Fines J.P. Morgan Securities
JPMorgan to Pay $151M Over Misleading Disclosures
Settlement Over Short Interest Reporting Violations
reasoning: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has charged J.P. Morgan Securities LLC and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. for various failures, including misleading disclosures and breach of fiduciary duty.
J.P. Morgan will pay over $150 million to settle multiple SEC charges, reflecting significant regulatory scrutiny.
The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has fined J.P. Morgan Securities LLC $200 million for failing to supervise its business effectively.
The SEC has settled five administrative actions against J.P. Morgan affiliates for misleading disclosures and other violations.
J.P. Morgan Securities has been fined $200 million by the CFTC due to order surveillance failures.
JPMorgan Chase will pay $151 million for misleading disclosures related to its private funds, as per SEC findings.
J.P. Morgan Securities LLC has settled with FINRA over short interest reporting violations, resulting in a $3 million fine.
